DOC.brief_summary: Recruitment of 28 subjects that will be randomized to consume fruit or nuts as snacks between regular meals for two months. Laboratory tests for cardiovascular risk factors, metabolic rate, liver steatosis and physical activity are investigated ahead of start of the study and at the end of the trial period och two months. Participants will be allowed to buy fruits or nuts on their own but to keep track (diaries) of the amount consumed. They will be reimbursed for the costs of the snacks.
DOC.brief_title: Prospective Randomized Trial of Fruits or Nuts Eaten Between Regular Meals in Healthy Subjects
DOC.criteria: healthy subjects significant diseases that can affect outcomes, mental disorders that can affect participation.
DOC.keyword: fruit, nuts, liver fat, insulin, glucose
Focus of the study is to compare the often given advice to eat fruit, containing large amount of glucose and fructose, with nuts that are more rich in fat.
